alert.note: Alert for Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 29 at 8:02AM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 8 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Flat Tops and Gore and Elk Mountains/Central Mountain Valleys. * WHEN...From this evening through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys
